title: AI Usage Context Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of the different purposes for which AI-generated content is created in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each usage context (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

character_development.description: Creating or enhancing character profiles, personalities, motivations, or arcs.

world_building.description: Developing the setting, cultures, geography, or systems that make up the narrative universe.

plot_generation.description: Creating narrative structures, story beats, or plot outlines that guide the overall story.

scene_generation.description: Writing specific moments or interactions that will appear directly in the narrative.

dialogue_creation.description: Developing the spoken exchanges between characters, with attention to voice and subtext.

lore_expansion.description: Adding depth to existing worldbuilding by creating additional history, myths, or background elements.

narrative_outlining.description: Structuring the overall story flow, chapter breakdowns, or episode sequences.

backstory_creation.description: Developing historical events or experiences that shaped characters or settings prior to the main narrative.

description_enhancement.description: Improving or creating sensory details, atmospheric elements, or visual characteristics.

conflict_development.description: Designing obstacles, antagonistic forces, dilemmas, or other challenges that drive the narrative.

relationship_mapping.description: Creating or elaborating connections, histories, and dynamics between characters or factions.

timeline_construction.description: Organizing events chronologically and establishing causal relationships between occurrences.

perspective_exploration.description: Examining narrative events or worldbuilding elements from different character viewpoints.

setting_detailing.description: Elaborating specific locations with architectural, geographical, or atmospheric details.

artifact_design.description: Creating significant objects, technologies, or items with physical descriptions and narrative significance.

organization_structuring.description: Developing groups, factions, governments, or other collective entities within the narrative world.

magic_system_development.description: Creating or enhancing supernatural elements, including rules, limitations, and cultural integration.

technology_conceptualization.description: Designing futuristic or alternative technological systems, devices, or scientific principles.

cultural_elaboration.description: Developing customs, traditions, arts, languages, or social structures for groups within the narrative.

literary_adaptation.description: Transforming content between different media forms, story structures, or narrative approaches.

historical_event_creation.description: Designing significant past occurrences that shaped the narrative world's current state.

game_mechanics_design.description: Developing systems, rules, or interactive elements for gameplay or tabletop experiences.
